results.title: Trout that stole the rainbow
results.creator_credit: Eva Szasz, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this original fable the world loses its colours when a trout, obsessed by the beauty of the rainbow, steals it from the sky. As punishment, the sun paints the trout in rainbow colours that can be enjoyed by all, but the trout himself.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eva Szasz, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Mary of Mile 18
results.creator_credit: Svend-Erik Eriksen, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Beautifully animated film about a family living in an isolated part of Canada. Highlights aspects of remote rural life, such as long travelling periods in difficult weather conditions, the need for family members to be conscientious about various responsibilities around the farm and the closeness that can develop between members of a farming family. The story centres around a farm girl whose father will not allow her to keep a stray puppy until an event occurs that makes him reverse his decision. Based on a award-winning children’s book by Ann Blades.

results.title: 64,000,000 years ago
results.creator_credit: Bill Maylone, George Johnson, John Taylor, National Film Board of Canada and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: This short animated film for children looks at the last of the great dinosaurs to stalk the central plains of North America. Lifelike models of ornithomimus, edmontosaur, and triceratops recreate the late Cretaceous period, offering a view of how our world may have looked 64,000,000 years ago. The soundtrack is filled with growls and roars with the occassional voice-over narration.

results.title: Marusska and Wolf Castle
results.creator_credit: Edgar Dutka, Vlasta Pospislova, Miroslav Kubricht, BFA Films and Video, Kratky Film and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the traditional Moravian tale of Marusska, a poor mountain girl, who dares to enter a haunted wolf castle and subsequently suffers the curse of the she-wolf.

results.title: Coastal dunes
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Uses an experimental approach to explain the process of saltation (sand movement) in a typical English coastal dune system. Also explains the interrelationships that exist between vegetation and soil type - the changing nature of these two elements is shown by a transect taken across a typical dune system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: The Big green caterpillar. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Uses close-up photography to show the development of the caterpillar from the egg to the pupa and then to the butterfly stage. Narrated by Jill Taggart. Suitable for primary years prep-6.

results.title: The Best of zoom Martha
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of Martha Rudolph, a teenager suffering from epilepsy. Shows her positive outlook on life as well as her family’s reactions to her disability. Also mentions that there are degrees of epilepsy and provides a brief explanation of why epileptic fits occur.

results.title: Saying no: a few words to young women about sex
results.creator_credit: Karen Crommie, David Crommie and Crommie and Crommie
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this film shows them how to cope with demands made by boys or men for sexual relations when they do not wish to participate. Highlights some standard manipulative responses by males to females when they are denied sex and indicates how girls should go about handling such responses in an assertive manner.

results.title: Better safe than sorry
results.brief_description: This film depicts situations that children could encounter with strangers, as well as with known adults, that involve physical and sexual abuse and shows children how to deal with these potential situations. Stresses that children are in no way to blame for the deviant behaviour of adults and should not feel guilty about their involvemenmt in these situations. Presents three rules for children to follow: SAY NO, GET AWAY, TELL SOMEONE. Suitable for Mid Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Acne...it's not your fault
results.brief_description: Outlines the various types of acne suffered by adolescents ranging from a few spots to severe inflamation and indicates the treatment required for each of these stages of acne severity. Stresses that bad acne needs treatment by a medical practitioner.
